name: prefabrication
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of making parts in a factory that can be put together quickly, or of building something from these parts: Prefabrication of almost all building elements is now the norm. They specialize in prefabrication of small boats and ferries. See
prefabricated
More examplesFewer examplesHe is studying engineering with a specialty in prefabrication chip technology.The developer has built 1,500 homes with its own system of prefabrication.They depend on off-site prefabrication in factories by skilled, permanent employees.
